ABOUT
Maker Projects for Learning
CONTACTS

We believe that project based learning is the best way to teach STEM concepts. Here we present a variety of tutorials different projects that will lead you through a project while showing you how to apply theory to real world projects. These projects can serve as the basis for great portfolio projects or just personal projects. This work was done as part of an Interdisciplinary Qualifying Project at Worcester Polytechnic University.

PHILOSOPHY RESOURCES

Participate in the Study!

We are looking for students who are interested in participating in a study where they would take a survey before and after going through one of the projects. If this is something that you might be interested in doing, you can sign up for the mailing list at this survey. Being put on the mailing list does not mean you agree to submit to the study, but it is the best way to get informatino about how to formally join the study.

GET INVOLVED!

Design a Carabiner

Follow along with the tutorial to design a 3d printable carabiner. Learn about mechanical stress and use various tools to improve the strength of your design.

LEARN MORE

Make a Video Game

Make a simple 2D video game using the Unity game engine. Prior programming experience is not required.

LEARN MORE

Design CNC Machines

Learn about the operating principles of CNC machines and follow along in CAD to design simple 1 and 2 axis machines. If you're feeling up to the challenge you can even gather the parts to assemble your own 2 axis pen plotter.

LEARN MORE
